sub_title: Full professor and Chair Holder Landscape Architecture
summary:
As a landscape architect and urban designer my passion is to create evidence-based and aesthetically innovative designs for the spatial environment. To support this, I combine the development of Research Through Design methods and conducting research to create a solid evidence base.

I foster 'deeply integrated design' as an overarching method that combines designing with the complex air-, water-, land-, and soilscape systems. For more information, see my inaugural speech; (chrome-extension://efaidnbmnnnibpcajpcglclefindmkaj/https://edepot.wur.nl/570636)

projects.title: National growth fund: multifunctional quay wall environments
projects.description: In this large project that forms a part of the cluster for a future proof living environment, the work package on the integrative Research Through Design (RTD) process is run by a team from my group. The RTD methodology forms the backbone of the entire project and forms the linking pin of expertise about Construction and Materials, Building Logistics, Utility Infrastructure, Biodiversity, Climate Adaptation, Heritage and Asset management.

projects.title: Cultural heritage and participation
projects.description: This project aims to develop and share scientific knowledge about a spatial and design approach to heritage, in strong cooperation between society, the heritage sector and academia. The cases to explore the approach are situated in provinces Drenthe (gemeente Westerveld, and the colonies of benevolence) and Overijssel

projects.title: Research through design to prevent urban heat in Dutch cities
projects.description: Research through design to prevent urban heat in Dutch cities is conducted in eight projects in the municipalities of Amsterdam and Arnhem to understand the best ways to implement urban climate knowledge into the design process

contributors.headline: Full professor and Chair Holder Landscape Architecture
Landscape architect / researcher / lecturer at Landscape Architecture Group  Wageningen University & Research

projects.title: Experimental cool spot Gelderland
projects.description: The implementation of climate responsive measures is difficult because people are not yaware of the impact of urban climate.  WUR, the Province of Gelderland, the municipality of Arnhem, Rheden and Nijmegen are therefore developing an installation in the public space. This object is modular and can consist of different building blocks that can be moved and placed in different ways. The object is temporary and forms a roadshow: it will be displayed on three squares in Arnhem, Nijmegen and Rheden. The object cools the public space through greening, shading and water evaporation. In addition to the climate-adaptive effects, the structure generates a wow effect, amazes, informs, surprises, elicits a certain reaction or behavior or raises questions among passers-by, entrepreneurs and/or local residents

projects.description: Climate change will have a big impact on life in the Netherlands in the decades to come. WUR researchers came up with scenarios for the city of the future to help Dutch cities prepare for the new, often more extreme conditions they will have to deal with.

projects.title: REALCOOL
projects.description:
In many cities climate change calls for adaptation. Urban heat problems will be exacerbated and peak rains will increase. Especially in inner city areas that often form urban heat islands, 
these climate problems need to be solved. It was believed that urban water bodies help to ease heat problems there. Recent research shows that this is often not the case. But there are hints that properly designed water environments could be really cooling. We will study which configurations of shading, evaporation and ventilation objects around the water bodies will improve human thermal sensation in cities. We will also test such new water bodies on their visual appeal and their fit with other urban functions in a consortium with other designers, consultants and municipalities. The outcome of this Research Through Design are design prototypes for really cooling urban water bodies to be implemented by urban design professionals.

projects.title: CLIMADAPTOOL- making urban climate and adaptation visible via a smartphone app
projects.description: Amsterdam has urban climate problems and these can be solved with many design interventions. In this project, we will develop a smartphone app in which people can see what the actual local urban climate is like in their direct living environment and what they can do to improve it. The app and underlying information is developed by a team of climate responsive design specialist Sanda Lenzholzer, landscape architect Claire Oude Aarninkhof, urban climate specialists Gert-Jan Steeneveld and Natalie Theeuwes as well as web app creator Gert-Sterenborg. Together with stakeholders and citizens the team works for one year.
